results.title: The Indian army
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes a tour of the modern Indian army, paying special attention to a regiment that was once known as the First Bengal Lancers.

results.title: The Moghul emperors
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
The Moghuls, described by some historians as the most brilliant dynasty of emperors in modern times, ruled India from the 16th century to the middle of the 18th century. Keith Adam visits many of the monuments they created, including the Taj Mahal, and recreates their colourful history.
results.description:

results.title: The Kulu valley
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes viewers on a trek through the Kulu Valley in the middle of the Himalayan Mountain Range, a fertile strip of flat land between high snow-capped mountains.

results.title: Simla
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam recalls the days of the British Raj. He visits Simla, the town in the Himalayas which the British created during the nineteenth century.

results.title: A Simple good time
results.creator_credit: Bill Steller, Chris McCullough, Australia-Japan Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
Describes the way the Japanese take holidays which are usually short and in the company of workmates. It explores their character by following a group of factory workers as they go on a weekend holiday tour of the southern island of Kyushu. We also see how weddings and honeymoons are conducted on Kyushu. Presented by Keith Adam.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Steller, Chris McCullough, Australia-Japan Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
